business.headline: Daughter's future? Which is better- Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana or ELSS?SSY offers 8.2% as an annual interest rate. Investors can invest a minimum of Rs 250, while the maximum limit is Rs 1.5 lakh per year. Further, this scheme allows tax benefits under Sector 80C of the Income Tax Act 1961.

Money after divorce: How courts calculate alimonyAlimony in India does not follow a fixed formula. Courts consider various factors such as the financial position of both spouses, their earning potential, and their contributions to the marriage.

Jio Financial, Allianz likely reach deal for insurance joint venture in India: ReportJio Financial Services has reached an initial deal for a joint venture with Allianz SE to form an insurance business in India.
Sensex ends 900 points higher, Nifty over 23,100; Airtel gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 899.01 points to close at 76,348.06, while the NSE Nifty50 added 283.05 points to end at 23,190.65.

Worker regrets moving from Noida to Bengaluru for Rs 30,000 hike. Here's whyIn a recent social media post, a corporate employee described Bengaluru as "dirty, unorganised," with bad roads and the worst traffic. Apart from infrastructure issues, the worker also mentioned feeling a "north vs south" divide in everyday interactions.

Air India in talks to buy more widebody jets from Airbus and Boeing: ReportThe potential order is expected to be worth billions of dollars and could help the airline expand its long-haul fleet as it undergoes a major transformation under Tata Group ownership.

Sensex soars over 900 points: 3 factors behind stock market rallyShare market today: This week has been one of the best for Dalal Street this year. The S&P BSE Sensex surged 818.21 points to 76,267.26, while the NSE Nifty50 jumped 254.50 points to 23,162.10 at 1:33 pm.

Boeing plane delays clip Akasa Air's wings, pilots left waiting: ReportAkasa is among many global airlines affected by Boeing's production issues, which have been worsened by regulatory scrutiny and a workers' strike.

Nithin Kamath's advice to investors amid market volatility : 'Cut your losers'Zerodha's Nithin Kamath shared an essential trading rule that is knowing when to exit a bad trade. Kamath explained that traders often hold on to losing positions, hoping they will recover. But instead of hoping, traders should act with caution and cut their losses early.

IndiGo shares soar after recent update, hit record high. Buy, sell or hold?In just 5 trading sessions, the stock has soared roughly 8%. IndiGo's stock is up over 10% this year and nearly 13% in a month. The latest jump in its share price came after the company recently shared its roadmap for FY30.

Adani group in $1.4 billion deal talks to buy Emaar's India business: ReportEmaar India has a strong presence in residential and commercial real estate across multiple states, including New Delhi, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Madhya Pradesh, Rajasthan.

Government simplifies compounding rules, relaxes process for tax defaultersThe move aims to provide relief to taxpayers, to settle matters smoothly with the tax authorities and reduce unnecessary litigation.

entertainment.headline: Janhvi Kapoor gets a special gift from Ram Charan's wife Upasana on RC 16 setRam Charan's wife, Upasana Konidela, recently visited the RC 16 set and gave a special gift to Janhvi Kapoor.

Hema Malini's Indian Idol photo raises question again: Are reality shows scripted?Actor-MP Hema Malini's recent appearance on the Indian reality show, Indian Idol, raised questions about the authenticity of such series. We spoke to industry insiders and experts about the same.

Kim Soo-hyun files criminal lawsuit against Sae-ron's family amid controversyActor Kim Soo-hyun's agency has filed criminal lawsuits over a controversial photo shared online by Kim Sae-ron's family. His participation in a Taiwan event is also under review due to the scandal.

Gwyneth Paltrow on filming sex scenes with Timothee Chalamet in Marty SupremeHollywood star Gwyneth Paltrow, who will soon be seen in the film Marty Supreme, with acclaimed actor Timothee Chalamet, reacted to filming intimate scenes with the Oscar-nominated artiste.

Tamannaah says she's 'private about personal life' amid breakup with Vijay VarmaActor Tamannaah Bhatia reflected on her stardom and its impact on her personal life. The actor recently parted ways with Vijay Varma.

Salaar re-release: Why Prabhas's film deserves to be classic while fans await Part 2Prabhas and Prithviraj Sukumaran's Salaar: Part 1 - Ceasefire is gearing up for a re-release on March 21. Ahead of the re-release, let us revisit Salaar and why it deserves the cult-classic status.

Baida review: Good story, slow pace in Sourabh Raaj Jain's supernatural thrillerReleased-Fri Mar 21, 2025'Baida' is a supernatural thriller, but even with its decent performances, it falls short somewhere. The film stars Sudhanshu Rai, Hiten Tejwani, and Sourabh Raaj Jain, among others, in a story which has the potential to entertain.

Composer Amaal Mallik breaks ties with family, talks about clinical depressionComposer and singer Amaal Mallik opened up about his battle with clinical depression and the strained relationship with his brother Armaan Malik, blaming his parents for their distance. In a heartfelt Instagram post, he revealed that he will now maintain only professional ties with his family.

Rapper Eminem's former employer charged with selling his unreleased musicGrammy-winning rapper Eminem's former employer has been charged with selling the artiste's unreleased music. If found guilty, he could face a fine of $250,000 and a prison term of at least five years.

Pakistani actor Danish Taimoor apologises for polygamy comments: Love my wife a lotPakistani actor Danish Taimoor received a lot of backlash after he appeared on a national channel and made comments about polygamy. In a video now, he shared that he loves his wife a lot and admitted that his choice of words was probably not right.

Malayalam cinema's February fiasco: 17 films, Rs 75 crore budget, Rs 23 crore returnsDo you think Malayalam cinema is belting out one thriller after another and raking in the moolah? A latest report from the producers' association says otherwise. 17 films were released in February, but only one of them was able to collect closer to its budget.

KJo reveals funny reason why Akshay Kumar speaks in Punjabi during negotiationsAt the trailer launch of Akaal, Karan Johar shared a funny story about Akshay Kumar's use of Punjabi to keep conversations private. He also highlighted Bollywood's Punjabi roots and his own linguistic background.

Khakee The Bengal Chapter review: Consistent, pacy, binge-worthy thrillerReleased-Thu Mar 20, 2025Khakee The Bengal Chapter Review: Neeraj Pandey creates a gripping fictional crime thriller set in the 2000s Bengal political landscape, featuring a stellar ensemble cast. The series is now streaming on Netflix.

KJo's trivia for trolls: 90 per cent of filmmakers at Dharma are outsidersFilmmaker Karan Johar shared a statement about announcing Dharma's 'proudest' film soon. He even wrote about launching Dharma's 24th debutant director along with the movie.

Oscar-winning actor Cate Blanchett doesn't want award shows to airHollywood star Cate Blanchett wants to go back to the era of private award shows, where everything was not televisied or available for consumption on social media.

Rajinikanth, Rajamouli floored by Mohanlal's Empuraan trailer: Magnetic, fantasticRajinikanth and SS Rajamouli dedicated an appreciatory note to Mohanlal and Prithviraj Sukumara's 'L2: Empuraan'. They acknowledged the efforts of the film's team and wished them the best for release.

Imran Khan makes rare appearance with girlfriend Lekha Washington. WatchActor Imran Khan and his girlfriend Lekha Washington were seen together in the city, making a rare public appearance. The couple was photographed holding hands and posing for cameras.

Actor Ranjeet says Madhuri Dixit was terrified to shoot with him: Never touched herVeteran actor Ranjeet recalled shooting with Madhuri Dixit on the sets of 'Prem Pratigya'. He shared that Dixit was so terrified of him that she first refused to shoot the scene initially.

Kartik Aaryan receives Maharashtrian Of The Year 2025 awardActor Kartik Aaryan was honoured with the Maharashtrian Of The Year award by Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, Deputy Chief Minister Eknath Shinde, and Governor CP Radhakrishnan.

general news.headline: X sues government for using IT Act to block content, says arbitrary censorshipElon Musk's X — earlier known as Twitter — has sued the Indian government for using the Information Technology Act to block tweets and other content on the platform. X says that the provision does not grant the government powers to block tweets.

Disha Salian's father seeks probe on Aaditya Thackeray, MLA says bid to defameDisha Salian, who was late actor Sushant Singh Rajput's former manager, was found dead in June 2020. The petition alleged that Disha was gang-raped and murdered.

Devendra Fadnavis says strict MCOCA laws would be invoked against cow smugglersDevendra Fadnavis said that if someone is found repeatedly involved in cow smuggling, action will be taken against them under MCOCA.

World Happiness Report is out and war-torn nations are happier than IndiansAre you happy? Do the people around you seem happy? While this question might invite deep reflection, the answer to personal happiness often boils down to a simple 'Yes' or 'No.' The 2025 World Happiness Report is out and Finland has topped the list. Check out India's ranking.
Stanley cups, sunscreen tubes… so we're bedazzling everything now?'What's a girl gonna do? A diamond's gotta shine'.

Papa is in drum, Meerut man's daughter told neighbours after wife killed himThe five-year-old daughter of the Meerut woman, who killed her husband with her lover's help, reportedly told neighbours that her father was inside the drum. The claim was made by the mother of victim, Saurabh Rajput.

Watch: Yuzvendra Chahal wears 'be your own sugar daddy' T-shirt to divorce hearingIndia cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal was seen wearing a T-shirt with a message that read 'be your own sugar daddy' during his divorce plea hearing at a family court in Mumbai on Thursday.

Mounjaro, popular weight-loss drug, launched in India. Here's how much it costsPopular anti-diabetes and obesity drug Mounjaro, containing the active ingredient tirzepatide, is now available in India in a single-dose vial.

Money after divorce: How courts calculate alimonyAlimony in India does not follow a fixed formula. Courts consider various factors such as the financial position of both spouses, their earning potential, and their contributions to the marriage.
Jaipur woman, lover kill husband. CCTV shows them carrying body on bikeJaipur police said Dhannalal Saini, a vegetable vendor, was killed after he got wind of his wife's illicit affair.

Karnataka plans to introduce sex education classes 14 years after rejecting itKarnataka plans to introduce sex education for Classes 8-12, a move contrasting with past resistance from the state on this topic,  alongside moral education for younger students. India has also had a history of controversies whenever sex education is brought up.

BCCI lifts saliva ban in landmark post-Covid move after captains' approvalThe Board of Control for Cricket India (BCCI) has lifted the ban on the usage of saliva on balls during matches in the Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025, the first time since the law was enforced in 2020 during the Covid-19 pandemic.

What happens when you cut out carbs? A nutrition coach's eye-opening experimentNutrition coach Justin Gichaba went on a zero-carb diet for seven days. Read on to see how it affected his body and why carbohydrates are essential for those with intense workout routines.

Capable women with earning capacity shouldn't ask for interim alimony: High CourtThe court said that Section 125 (order for maintenance of wives, children and parents) of the CrPC carried the legislative intent to maintain equality among spouses and provide protection to the wives, children and parents, but didn't promote idleness.

What is Tamil Nadu's fire season? Understanding its growing threatTamil Nadu's forests face an escalating wildfire crisis, with rising frequency and intensity. Driven by extreme heat, human activities, and dry conditions. But they are not a new phenomenon; they are making news now because these fires threaten ecosystems, livelihoods and safety.

Grabbing girl's breasts, breaking pyjama string not rape: High CourtThe court held that while the acts were "serious and shameful", they did not meet the legal threshold for attempted rape, warranting trial under "aggravated sexual assault" and disrobing charges instead.

How Sambhaji Maharaj's 9-year struggle doomed Aurangzeb and the Mughal empire's fallCrowned as the Chhatrapati of Marathas in 1681 after Shivaji's death, Sambhaji Maharaj did not merely inherit the throne, but the smouldering legacy of Swarajya. Sensing weakness, the Mughals kept doggedly pursuing him, and he was captured after nine years of resistance. Sambhaji endured 40 days of savage torture at the hands of Aurangzeb -- his eyes gouged out, his tongue cut out -- but still, he would neither surrender nor convert.

Grok under scrutiny over use of slang: Who bears the blame?AI chatbot Grok's responses to users in India have gone viral over its use of Hindi slang and unfiltered language. Who can be held liable for the answers generated by Grok and to what extent?

Where is empathy? Lisa Ray slams Air India after father denied medical waiverActor Lisa Ray called out Air India for denying a medical waiver to her 92-year-old father despite a doctor's certificate. The airline responded, saying they would review the matter.

Yuzvendra Chahal, Dhanashree Verma granted divorce by Mumbai family courtIndian cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal and Dhanashree Verma were granted a divorce by a family court in Mumbai on Thursday, March 20. The Bombay High Court had directed the family court to expedite the proceedings, considering Chahal's commitments for IPL 2025.

Composer Amaal Mallik breaks ties with family, talks about clinical depressionComposer and singer Amaal Mallik opened up about his battle with clinical depression and the strained relationship with his brother Armaan Malik, blaming his parents for their distance. In a heartfelt Instagram post, he revealed that he will now maintain only professional ties with his family.

UP man self-operates after watching YouTube tutorial, hospitalisedWhen Raja Babu didn't find any relief after consulting several doctors, he decided to take matters into his own hands. After watching several videos on YouTube, he purchased medicines from a medical store, and then attempted the surgery on himself.

Rise or resurgence? Textile art in India goes mainstreamKnown fashion labels like Tarun Tahiliani, Pero and Anavila at art and home decor exhibitions? It certainly says something about the rise...errr... resurgence of textile art.

BCCI honours Champions Trophy-winning Indian team with cash reward of Rs 58 croreThe Board of Control for Cricket in India has announced a cash prize of Rs 58 crore for the Indian team that recently won the Champions Trophy after beating New Zealand in the final.
Janhvi Kapoor gets a special gift from Ram Charan's wife Upasana on RC 16 setRam Charan's wife, Upasana Konidela, recently visited the RC 16 set and gave a special gift to Janhvi Kapoor.

sports.headline: IPL 2025: Rain to play spoilsport in season opener between RCB and KKR in KolkataThe opening game of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) is in danger of being washed out as heavy rainfall and thunderstorms are likely to interrupt the game.

S Sreesanth praises Riyan Parag on his ascent to captaincy after prolific 2024 seasonFormer India fast bowler S Sreesanth praised Riyan Parag on being appointed as the captain of the Rajasthan Royals (RR) for the first three matches of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

IPL captains' meet: Pat Cummins odd man out in photoshoot near Gateway of IndiaIPL 2025: Pat Cummins and Shreyas Iyer took centrestage during the customary captains' photoshoot in Mumbai on Thursday. The new season will get underway in Kolkata on March 22.

NBA: Michael Malone fires back at criticism over Jokić, Murray's absenceDenver Nuggets head coach Michael Malone did not hold back after ESPN's Tim Bontemps criticized the team for sitting Nikola Jokić and Jamal Murray during the regular NBA game against the Golden State Warriors.

Watch: Abhishek Sharma warms up for IPL 2025 by breaking glasses in Hyderabad stadiumIndia and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) opener Abhishek Sharma broke the glass at the Rajiv Gandhi International Stadium in Hyderabad while practising for the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025).

Watch: Yuzvendra Chahal wears 'be your own sugar daddy' T-shirt to divorce hearingIndia cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal was seen wearing a T-shirt with a message that read 'be your own sugar daddy' during his divorce plea hearing at a family court in Mumbai on Thursday.

IPL 2025 New Rule Explained: 2 balls to be used in evening matches to counter dewThe Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) is set to introduce two new balls for the matches played in the evening to counter the dew factor.

Watch: PV Sindhu throws racquet in frustration after Swiss Open first-round exitSwiss Open 2025: PV Sindhu appeared frustrated after losing the first-round of the Super 300 in Basel on Wednesday. The star shuttle fought back from 9-16 down in the second game against lower-ranked Julie Dawall Jakobsen, but was not able to close out the match.

Bonus point system to be pondered over for WTC 2025-27 cycleThe International Cricket Council (ICC) is expected to consider a new bonus points system at its upcoming board meeting in April. This system could place greater emphasis on larger victories, particularly in overseas matches, for the next World Test Championship (WTC) cycle.

IPL 2025 New Rule Explained: 2 balls to be used in evening matches to counter dewThe Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) is set to introduce two new balls for the matches played in the evening to counter the dew factor.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
